You are on a boat. It's on fire: Did I mention the boat was ON FIRE?
You are in the water. You see a lifeboat and some floating debris
You climb into safety in the boat. So does everyone else, and the boat slowly begins to sink
The debris isn't much. but eventually you feel sand beneath your feet. You are on an island! What will you do first?
You see enough wreckage to build a simple shelter, but sadly no survivors. Do you:
Jump in the water: Explore the island to look for food

You are on a boat. It's on fire: In your exhausted state, you look around the island. But you fail to notice the cliff. You lose.
You feel surprisingly well-rested after a night in your shelter.
It's very difficult to start a fire without matches
You decide to look for food. You find some berries. On the way back to the campsite you see another box that washed ashore. It has matches!
Jump in the water: try again to start the fire

You are on a boat. It's on fire: You keep looking for food, but you don't find anything. You get lost and never find your way back to camp. You lose.
You go back to the fire and this time you can get it lit. In the distance, you see a dot on the horizon.
You swim to the boat, but it's farther than you though. And it's hard to swim when you've barely eaten. You lose
You build the fire larger, sending a black plume of smoke into the sky. The ship notices you. You are saved!
